snippet: Stripping Jews of their belongings was an essential part of the effort to destroy them.
abstract: Op-Ed article by social scientist Sarah Gensburger, in light of discovery of 1,400 paintings taken from Jews during the Nazi era, offers reminder that the bulk of anti-Semitic looting during World War II was widespread and banal, says the Nazis took everything, and forced Jews to sort and crate everything that had been taken.
lead_paragraph: Stripping Jews of their belongings was an essential part of the effort to destroy them.

headline.main: The Banality of Robbing the Jews
headline.print_headline: The Banality of Robbing the Jews
